title: NASA weighing continuing VERITAS versus future Discovery mission
summary: Budget pressures in NASA’s planetary science program could force the agency to choose between continuing a mission to Venus that has already been delayed or requesting proposals for a future mission.

title: Intelsat buys capacity on Hispasat’s Amazonas Nexus satellite
summary: Intelsat has acquired a “significant amount” of capacity from the recently launched Amazonas Nexus satellite to meet demand for connectivity over the Americas, an executive for the company told SpaceNews.

title: FCC unveils proposed satellite direct-to-device regulatory framework
summary: The U.S. Federal Communications Commission unveiled its proposed framework March 17 for regulating the use of terrestrial wireless spectrum from space for connecting smartphones beyond the reach of cell towers.

title: ULA Completes Vulcan Tanking Test, WDR Next
summary: The United Launch Alliance (ULA) team has completed the next phase of testing in preparation for the inaugural Vulcan rocket flight.

title: SpaceX conducts doubleheader with Starlink mission followed by launch for SES
summary: Hot on the heels of Tuesday’s successful CRS-27 launch, SpaceX’s Falcon 9 was in action again for a pair of back-to-back missions from both coasts Friday, tasked with deploying communications satellites into orbit.
